title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
summary: A series of personal writings by the Roman Emperor, exploring Stoic philosophy. Marcus Aurelius reflects on life, virtue, and the nature of the universe, offering timeless wisdom and guidance.

title: The Republic
author: Plato
summary: An influential work by Plato, discussing justice, the nature of the soul, and the ideal state. The dialogue unfolds as Socrates engages with other characters, exploring profound philosophical questions.

title: Beyond Good and Evil
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
summary: Nietzsche's exploration of morality, individualism, and the nature of truth. In 'Beyond Good and Evil,' he challenges conventional moral concepts and advocates for a reevaluation of values.
